business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end lower as RBI inflation outlook triggers profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 161.71 points to close at 81,467.10, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 31.20 points to end at 24,981.95.

DA hike: Will Centre offer a festive gift for government employees?Currently, central government employees receive DA at 50% of their basic salary, and pensioners receive DR at 50% of their basic pension.

Multibagger power stock hits record high peak on massive Rs 1,680 crore orderA total of 1.51 lakh shares were traded, resulting in a turnover of Rs 29.36 crore on the BSE. The company's market capitalisation rose to Rs 92,624 crore following the surge in its stock price.

RBI raises UPI Lite, UPI 123Pay limits at MPC: How it affects your walletRBI MPC meeting: The central bank raised the transaction limits for two key UPI services—UPI 123Pay and UPI Lite—offering more convenience for millions of users.

RBI MPC meeting: Key takeaways on GDP growth, inflation, and interest rateRBI MPC meeting: The committee led by Governor Shaktikanta Das decided to keep interest rates unchanged and shifted its policy stance from 'withdrawal of accommodation' to 'neutral'.
Stock market rally: Sensex surges 600 points as RBI holds repo rate The S&P BSE Sensex added 591.46 points to 82,225.81, while the NIfty50 gained 197 points to 25,210.15.
Hyundai Motor IPO opens on October 15: All you need to know Hyundai Motor India aims to raise Rs 27,855 crore, making it the largest IPO in the history of the Indian stock market.

RBI keeps repo rate unchanged at 6.5%, GDP for FY25 projected at 7.2% RBI Monetary Policy Meeting: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has decided to leave policy rates unchanged, maintaining the current levels. However, it has adjusted its stance to a neutral position.
Sensex, Nifty open higher ahead of RBI decision; Tata Motors stock gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 129.72 points to 81,764.53, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 46.35 points to 25,059.50.

Gold, silver price today, October 9, 2024: Yellow metal records dip, silver trades higher on MCXGold Price Today 9 October 2024: Gold is trading on the lower side while silver rates have recorded a hike on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Wednesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

US aviation agency issues safety alert over Boeing 737 rudder issueAlert comes after National Transportation Safety Board says foreign airlines could be using planes with rudder components that could pose safety risks
Paytm shares rally 18% in last-hour surge: Is there more upside? Despite the rally in shares, Paytm's stock is still down 24.51% from its 52-week high of Rs 998.30, recorded on August 20, 2023.

More trouble for Ola Electric, transport ministry to investigate complaintsThe complaints against Ola Electric have been growing in recent months, with issues ranging from service quality, customer support, to product reliability.
Sensex, Nifty end higher led by auto and financial; Paytm shares jump 16%The S&P BSE Sensex added 584.81 points to end at 81,634.81, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 217.40 points to close at 25,013.15.

Tata Group stock falls 4% as Jhunjhunwala eyes exit from multibaggerThe Jhunjhunwala family first invested in Tata Motors in the September 2020 quarter, when Rakesh Jhunjhunwala picked up 4 crore shares of the company

Explained: Why SpiceJet shares jumped 9% todaySpiceJet recently raised Rs 3,000 crore through a qualified institutional placement (QIP). The airline is also set to receive an additional Rs 736 crore from a previous funding round, which will help support its growth plans.

Cognizant favoured H-1B holders over non-Indian workers, says US juryThis case dates back to 2017 when a class-action lawsuit was filed against the IT giant, accusing it of bias in its employment practices.
Crude oil prices seem to stabilise as all-out war fears recedeTensions between Israel and Iran led to a 13 per cent spurt in Brent crude prices in the past seven days.

Stock market reacts to China stimulus: Is there further dip in Sensex, Nifty?Despite some analysts hoping that foreign portfolio investment (FPI) outflows from India might reverse, further declines in Indian stocks cannot be dismissed, as per experts.
Ola Electric shares fall 6% after show cause notice; drops 46% from peakOla Electric has been given 15 days to respond to the notice and will provide the required documents within that time frame.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Poll body's sharp reaction to Congress's 'Haryana results unacceptable' remarkThe meeting comes after several Congress leaders claimed doubts over the vote-counting process in several constituencies.

Under Haryana shock, Congress snubbed by ally Samajwadi Party before UP by-pollsThe Congress wanted to contest five seats, but the Samajwadi Party hesitated, citing its performance in the general elections held from April to June and the recent Haryana polls.

Savitri Jindal, 2 other Independents back BJP after party's Haryana stunnerIndependent MLAs Savitri Jindal, Rajesh Joon and Devender Kadyan, backed the BJP on Wednesday, a day after the party's historic hat-trick in the Haryana Assembly elections.

Why Congress lost Haryana polls? Preeti Choudhry's big takeawaysIndia Today's Preeti Chaudhary gives us a breakdown of the reasons why the Congress lost the polls in Haryana despite the BJP facing anti-incumbency.
BJP orders 1 kg of jalebi to Rahul Gandhi's home. Payment was cash on deliveryThe Haryana BJP placed an online order for 1 kg of jalebi for Rahul Gandhi in Delhi. The order was payment on delivery.

2nd T20I Live Score: India look to seal series as run fest awaits in DelhiIndia (IND) vs Bangladesh (BAN) 2nd T20I Live Score: Team India will look to seal the series against Najmul Shanto's Bangladesh in the second T20 Internationals of the three-match series at the Arun Jaitley Cricket Stadium in New Delhi on Wednesday.

Haryana Shocker: A BJP win, a Congress self-goalSo how did the BJP, written off by everyone, including privately by some of their own leaders, pull off a stunning upset against the odds and, in the face of a 10-year anti-incumbency score, a remarkable hat trick?
Chemistry Nobel to David Baker, Demis Hassabis, John Jumper for work on proteinsThe announcement is part of Alfred Nobel's will, which specifically mentioned chemistry as one of the key categories.

Is chewing raw curry leaves good for hair? After the buzz around fitkari, raw garlic, and Japanese drinking vinegar, social media has now turned its attention to curry leaves. But can chewing raw curry leaves really give you healthy hair?
6 injured in stabbing attack in Israel, police capture suspectSix people were left injured following a stabbing attack in Israel's Hadera on Wednesday.

Day after loss, Rahul Gandhi says party analysing unexpected Haryana resultCongress MP Rahul Gandhi broke his silence on his party's poor showing in Haryana and said the party was analysing the "unexpected result", while flagging complaints of vote counting irregularities in some Assembly seats.

Joe Root goes past Sunil Gavaskar, Brian Lara with 1st Test hundred in PakistanPakistan vs England, 1st Test: Joe Root hit his first Test hundred in Pakistan and took his tally to 35. He went past Sunil Gavaskar, Brian Lara, Younis Khan, and Mahela Jayawardene in the all-time list of Test centurions.

Why flu season is seeing a jump in dengue, malaria cases this yearThis flu season, fevers may signal more than just a common cold, as multiple diseases including dengue, malaria, chikungunya, and Covid-19 are on the rise.

PM tears into Congress after Haryana win: Tried to spread lies among DalitsVirtually addressing the people in Nagpur, PM Modi accused the Congress of trying to spread lies among the people of the Dalit community, adding that his government is committed to the welfare of all sections of society.

How BJP hat-trick will echo beyond Haryana. Explained in 4 pointsIn Haryana, the BJP snatched a surprise victory despite a 10-year anti-incumbency. The victory will reverberate in the three states going to polls next, and give the BJP ammunition to counter the Congress's resurgence narrative. Here's what the hat-trick means for the BJP explained in four points.

A Communist defeats an Islamist in rare Kashmir election battleThe political landscape of Jammu and Kashmir has undergone a sea change, but one of the constants is Mohammed Yousuf Tarigami. The CPM veteran has kept the Communist flag flying in Kulgam since 1996. This time, Tarigami defeated a Jamaat-backed rival, who sought votes in the name of Islam, with his development pitch.

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 trailer: It's Kartik Aryan's Rooh Baba vs two ManjulikasThe trailer of Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 was released today, October 9. The film, directed by Anees Bazmee, features Kartik Aaryan, Triptii Dimri, Vidya Balan and Madhuri Dixit in lead roles.

Why Nobel Prize winner Geoffrey Hinton's middle name is 'Everest'British-Canadian professor Geoffrey Hinton, widely known as the 'Godfather of AI,' was awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Physics for pioneering work in machine learning. Read why his middle name is 'Everest' and his family legacy. He shares the honour with John Hopfield.

Caught on CCTV: Gujarat woman dies after being hit by van while going homeA teenage girl was crushed to death after she was hit by a school van in a residential society in Gujarat's Bhavnagar district. The incident came days after her father's death due to a prolonged illness.

One question, two answers: Kamala Harris's CBS '60 Minutes' interview sparks rowA CBS '60 Minutes' interview with Vice President Kamala Harris has sparked controversy after two different versions of her response to the same question were circulated online.

Watch: NASA astronaut shares stunning timelapse of green, red auroras from spaceA NASA astronaut has shared a timelapse video of vibrant red and green auroras that he filmed from his vantage point aboard a spacecraft.

Chief Justice ahead of retirement: How will history judge my tenureDY Chandrachud, the 50th Chief Justice of India, assumed office on November 9, 2022. He is set to retire on November 8 after a two-year tenure.

How Google's AI solved grand biology challenge to win chemistry NobelAlphaFold, first introduced in 2020, demonstrated an unprecedented ability to predict protein structures with atomic-level accuracy.

Kolkata's quirky pujo pandals: From underwater metro to glowing Vegas sphereThe metro pandal celebrates 40 years of Kolkata Metro Rail, featuring a tribute to the newly launched Green Line underwater metro.
Watch: Sunidhi Chauhan singing Ben 10 theme song is nostalgia overloadSunidhi Chauhan took the audience of IIT Roorkee fest on a nostalgic trip by singing the Ben 10 theme song. Watch the video.

Elvish Yadav joins Roadies 20 as gang leaderBigg Boss OTT winner and popular YouTuber Elvish Yadav has joined MTV Roadies Double Cross as a new gang leader. The makers shared a new promo announcing the same on October 9.

A Complete Unknown trailer: Timothee Chalamet meets Johnny Cash in Bob Dylan filmThe first full trailer of A Complete Unknown is here. The Bob Dylan biopic stars Timothee Chalamet in the lead role. It releases in cinemas this Christmas.

BB18: Before fights with Vivian, Chaahat Pandey admitted she's image-consciousChaahat Pandey, in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital before entering the Bigg Boss 18 house, said that she always dreamt of being a part of the reality show. She also shared that she doesn't want to be perceived negatively on the show.

Godfather of AI says he is proud that one of his students fired Sam AltmanGeoffrey Hinton who on Tuesday won the 2024 Nobel Prize for Physics thanked his students in a press conference and said he is particularly proud of one of his students for firing Sam Altman.

Apple Watch helps save life of elderly woman, here is what happenedAn Apple Watch has once again proven its life-saving potential by helping an elderly woman detect a serious heart condition, prompting timely medical intervention.

Beats Solo Buds review: Punchy audio, compact design but lacks ANCBeats Solo Buds, priced at Rs 6,900, is one of the most affordable earbuds in the Beats universe. It has a punchy audio, a long-lasting battery, a light and compact design. However, at its price tag, the lack of ANC leaves you asking for more. Read the detailed review by India Today Tech to find out.

Dyson Ontrac headphone review: Unique, expensive and superb in so many waysDyson is better known for its hardy vacuum cleaners and air purifiers. But now the company is pushing into the personal audio market with Ontrac, headphones that we find in this review to be unique and superb in many ways, albeit quite pricey.

MCG undergoes transformation before Boxing Day Test vs India The Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) has undergone a transformation before the international cricket season starts with the ODI between Australia and Pakistan on November 4.

Brook goes past Dravid, Gavaskar with 4th Test hundred in PakistanPakistan vs England: Harry Brook hit his fourth Test hundred in Pakistan to become the overseas player with the joint-most Test hundreds in the country.
Ishan Kishan to lead Jharkhand in Ranji Trophy 2024-25 after four yearsWicketkeeper batter Ishan Kishan will be seen leading Jharkhand in the Ranji Trophy 2024-25 after a gap of four seasons.

Line judges to disappear as Wimbledon adopts electronic calling systemIn a significant move away from tradition, Wimbledon will use an electronic line-calling system. Line judges will not be part of the tournament for the first time in 138 years in 2025.

R Ashwin reveals how Pakistan vs England 1st Test can produce result on flat trackRavichandran Ashwin revealed how the Multan Test between Pakistan and England could produce a result. He suggested that the 3rd innings, which is that of Pakistan's, would need to go poorly to get a result.

Arshdeep Singh breaks into top 10 for first time, Hardik Pandya back in top 3ICC T20I Rankings: Left-arm fast bowler Arshdeep Singh broke into the top 10 in the men's bowling charts for the first time in his career. Hardik Pandya returned to the top 3 in all-rounders' list after his heroics against Bangladesh in Gwalior on Sunday, October 3.

Ex-Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp named Red Bull's global head of footballJurgen Klopp will advise the Red Bull network of clubs, including Leipzig in Germany and Salzburg in Austria, on key areas, including transfers and playing style. The 57-year-old German landed his first job since quitting as Liverpool coach at the end of the 2023-24 season.

Ben Stokes backs Joe Root to break Sachin Tendulkar's record for most Test runsEngland captain Ben Stokes has backed Joe Root to go on and break Sachin Tendulkar's record for the most runs in Tests. Root went past Alastair Cook to become England's leading run-getter in the longest format of the game on October 9, Wednesday.

Joe Root goes past Alastair Cook to become England's leading run-getter in TestsPakistan vs England: Joe Root went past Alastair Cook to become England's leading run-getter in Test cricket. He achieved the milestone on Day 3 of the first Test against Pakistan in Multan on October 9.

Mohammadreza Chiyaneh key for Haryana Steelers in season 11Big-money signing Mohammadreza Chiyaneh will be the key man for Haryana Steelers as they aim to finally win the Pro Kabaddi League title in season 11 of the competition.

Rohit was returning home from a training session in Mumbai.

Root went past Alastair Cook to become England's leading run-getter in the longest format of the game on October 9, Wednesday.

Rohit was returning home from a training session in Mumbai.

Want Joe Root, Ben Stokes in England squad for Champions Trophy: Eoin MorganEoin Morgan has said that he wants to see both Joe Root and Eoin Morgan be a part of the England squad for the ICC Champions Trophy in Pakistan. Root and Stokes have been away from the ODI team since World Cup 2023.

Paralympics gold medallist Sumit Antil wants to break 80m barrier in IndiaParis Paralympics gold medallist and world record holder in men's javelin F64 event, Sumit Antil, said that he wanted to break the 80m barrier in India. In an exclusive interview with India Today, Sumit spoke about his Games Village experience in Paris and the Indian sporting ecosystem.

Liverpool's Ibrahim Konate ready to support player strike over hectic scheduleLiverpool defender Ibrahim Konate has become the latest player to support a strike over the hectic football schedule. The ongoing season has seen an increase in games due to the remodelled European competitions and international matches.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
